results.title: A Young farmer views the problems in the Hawkes Bay Catchment District
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Soil Conservation and Rivers Control Council
results.brief_description: From Te Mata Peak Summit we view the fertile plains of the Hawkes Bay catchment, touring orchards, vineyards, and sheep farms. In the rolling hills surrounding the plains the soil erosion problems present themselves and the efforts to combat them are shown and discussed. Similar problems and conservation efforts are shown on the flats - flood control is also discussed.

results.title: A Year to Remember 1956
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1956 - Lord and Lady Mountbatten visit Sydney - Avalanche near Mt Kosciusko - UN Secretary Dag Hammerskjold visits Canberra Hungarian refugees arrive in Australia - Suez crisis - Salk polio vaccine Lew Hoad defeats Ken Rosewall at Wimbledon - Melbourne Olympic Games opened by Duke of Edinburgh - Australia wins record number of Olympic gold medals … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1955
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1955 -, Johnnie Ray arrives at Sydney Airport - HMAS Australia towed away for scrap - Frank Sinatra and daughter Nancy arrive in Australia - Shark attacks around Sydney - Katherine Hepburn and Robert Helpmann in Australia - Maitland hit by floods - Jack Davey and Bob Hope play golf - Australia wins Davis Cup - Darby Munro retires to become a trainer … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1954
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1954 - Royal tour of Australia- Queen attends surf carnival at Bondi - Australia wide diphtheria campaign - Hopalong Cassidy visits Australia - Lew Hoad called up for national service - Russians try to abduct Mrs Petrov - British Open won by Peter Thompson - Vancouver Empire Games Marjorie Jackson and Lorraine Crapp win gold medals - Bannister beats Landy in the mile … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1952
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1952 - Death of King George V1 - Launch of HMAS Voyager - 1952 Olympics Marjorie Jackson and Shirley Strickland win gold - Welcome home for Marjorie Jackson Whaling industry on Moreton Island - Severe drought in Northern Territory Western Australia and Queensland - Jimmy Carruthers wins world bantam weight title - Dave Sands killed in car crash - Frank Sedgeman weds Jean Spence … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1951
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1951 - Jubilee Year celebrations - John Foster Dulles arrives in Australia - Australia signs the Colombo Plan - Comedian Dick Bentley arrives in Sydney from London - HMAS Bataan arrives from Korea - National Military Training introduced - Eruption of Mt Lamington in New Guinea - Funerals of Ben Chifley and Flynn of the Outback - Jimmy Carruthers meets Elley Bennet … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1950
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1950 - Korean War - Prime Minister Attlee meets with President Truman and General Eisenhower - Australian Communist Party demonstrate against Anti-Red Bill - Sara Quads born - Menzie’s addresses American House of Representatives - Hayman Island Resort opened - Explosion at Garden Island - Junior Doubles championships Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall - Ossie Pickworth gives golf demonstration … and much more. results.title: A Year to Remember 1949
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1949 - Rolling strikes at coalfields by Communist Party members - Chifley orders use of troops in coal mine strikes - Town of Maitland hit by floods - First naturalisation ceremony - Rabbit plague in Victoria - Petrol rationing declared invalid - Woomera Rocket Range - New Guinea natives greet Governor General - Dutch submarine breaks up during gale in Sydney Harbour … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1948
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1948 - Cathode ray tube - Race for supremacy in rocketing and guided missiles - Olympic Games in London - Don Bradman announces his retirement - Work resumes on the Cahill Expressway - Whale tries to stop sharks attacking her cub - Lord and Lady Olivier visit Taronga Park Zoo - Chico Marx visits Australian military hospital … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1947
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1947 - Strike by Sydney waterside workers - Students demonstrate against Dutch policy in Indonesia - Factories introduce incentives to attract female staff - Dutch liner arrives in Sydney carrying Jewish migrants - Expedition seen in Antarctica - Jack Davey’s story about two monkeys at Taronga Park Zoo - Plague of Grasshoppers Moree, NSW - George Formby and wife arrive - Billy Cook wins Jockey’s Premiership … and much more. Rated: G
